metadata.title: 3.4 Practice A - Operations with Radicals
metadata.creator: admin
metadata.abstract: This document is for testing purposes only. The material that is presented here should be treated as an example only.

stack.p: Operations with radicals are like simplifying variables in algebra.
A radical is in its SIMPLEST FORM when:
1) The radicand has no perfect square other than 1. For example:
2) No radical appears in the denominator of a fraction (i.e., always RATIONALIZE the denominator). For example:
Write the following as mixed radicals.
